intro: Bidens odorata, commonly known as sweet blackberry. This herbaceous perennial is native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It features slender, hairy stems and small, yellow-orange flower heads that bloom from late spring to early fall. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are edible but have a mild, somewhat tart flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, ditches, and along stream banks.
